results_summary: Naringenin co-treatment alleviated CdCl2-induced kidney injury, oxidative stress, ER stress, and autophagy, demonstrating protective effects against cadmium toxicity. The study showed significant improvements in kidney function markers and stress-related protein expression.
population_specificity: 60 chickens divided into control and treatment groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the anti-inflammatory effects and mechanisms of naringenin in LPS-stimulated human periodontal ligament stem cells (hPDLSCs).
results_summary: Naringenin alleviated inflammatory factor expression and promoted hPDLSC proliferation, with the best anti-inflammatory effect at 20 μmol/L. It inhibited the NF-κB signaling pathway, similar to the NF-κB inhibitor BAY 11-7802.
population_specificity: Human periodontal ligament stem cells (hPDLSCs) stimulated with LPS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify potential gene targets of naringenin for treating intestinal metaplasia (IM) and validate its therapeutic effects.
results_summary: Naringenin improved intestinal epithelial metaplasia by modulating MTTP/APOB expression in both cell and animal models, suggesting it inhibits IM progression.
population_specificity: Preclinical (cell and animal models) and bioinformatics analysis of clinical samples (GEO dataset GSE78523).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effects of long-term Naringenin (NRG) treatment on Alzheimer's disease (AD) by assessing its impact on cognitive function, amyloid-β deposition, and neuroinflammation.
results_summary: NRG improved learning and memory in APP/PS1 mice, reduced amyloid-β deposition, decreased microglial and astrocytic activation, and lowered pro-inflammatory cytokine levels. It also inhibited the MAPK signaling pathway, suggesting a potential mechanism for its anti-inflammatory effects.
population_specificity: APP/PS1 mice (a model for Alzheimer's disease) and LPS/Aβ-stimulated BV2 cells (a microglial cell line).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize existing literature on naringenin as a potential anti-cancer agent and clarify its mechanisms of action in cancer treatment.
results_summary: Naringenin affects multiple cancer-related pathways, including cell cycle arrest, anti-metastasis, apoptosis, anti-angiogenesis, and DNA repair, by altering molecular targets like drug transporters, transcription factors, and inflammatory cytokines. It shows promise as a candidate for medicines, nutraceuticals, and dietary supplements in cancer management.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or in vivo cancer cells, based on abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate naringenin's anticancer potential, including its mechanisms of action and effects on various cancer types.
results_summary: Naringenin demonstrated pleiotropic anticancer properties, such as inhibiting growth factors, cytokines, and cell cycle progression, and modulating cellular signaling pathways. It showed efficacy in multiple cancer types, including breast, colon, lung, and others, through anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and anti-metastatic effects.
population_specificity: Human and animal studies (in vitro and in vivo) across various cancer types.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective effects of naringenin (NAR) against aluminum nanoparticle (Al-NPs)-induced neurodegeneration and behavioral alterations in mice.
results_summary: Naringenin significantly attenuated Al-NPs-induced neurobehavioral impairments, oxidative stress, DNA damage, cytokine level alterations, and β-amyloid aggregation in the brain. It also restored antioxidant enzyme activity and reduced histopathological changes.
population_specificity: Mice exposed to aluminum nanoparticles (Al-NPs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin enhances the anticancer effects of ferroptosis inducers in liver cancer by modulating lipid metabolism via the AMPK-PGC1α signaling axis.
results_summary: Naringenin at non-toxic doses significantly enhanced the anticancer effects of ferroptosis inducers (erastin, RSL3, and sorafenib) by increasing lipid peroxidation and ferroptotic damage in liver cancer cells. The synergistic effect was mediated through inhibition of aerobic glycolysis via the AMPK-PGC1α pathway.
population_specificity: Liver cancer cell lines and xenograft mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-aging effects of Naringenin (NAR) on brain aging, focusing on lifespan extension, healthspan improvement, and its mechanism of action in C. elegans and middle-aged mice.
results_summary: NAR extended lifespan and improved healthspan in C. elegans and promoted metabolic enzyme activity, SIRT1 expression, and upregulation of antioxidant, anti-senescence, and anti-inflammatory markers in middle-aged mice.
population_specificity: C. elegans (nematodes) and middle-aged mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of naringenin (NAR) in cancer treatment, focusing on its effects on mitochondrial complex II and its potential as an anti-cancer agent.
results_summary: NAR exhibits anti-cancer effects through mechanisms like apoptosis induction, cell cycle arrest, angiogenesis restriction, and modulation of signaling pathways. However, its poor bioavailability, water solubility, and instability in acidic environments limit its clinical application.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or in vivo models not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate Naringenin's protective effects against UV-B-induced mitochondrial fragmentation and inflammation in human dermal fibroblasts and Balb/c mice.
results_summary: Naringenin restored UV-B-induced mitochondrial imbalance, inhibited NFкB phosphorylation, reduced pro-inflammatory cytokines, alleviated oxidative stress, and prevented inflammatory responses in mice.
population_specificity: Primary human dermal fibroblasts (HDFs) and Balb/c mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin and its nanocomposite (CMC-Nar) could mitigate drought stress effects in Cuminum cyminum by enhancing plant tolerance through physiological and biochemical mechanisms.
results_summary: The study found that both naringenin and CMC-Nar nanocomposite improved plant growth, photosynthetic parameters, and stress markers under drought conditions, with the nanocomposite showing superior effects. Additionally, biochemical and phytochemical parameters like soluble sugars, total proteins, and phenols increased, while stress markers like malondialdehyde and H2O2 decreased.
population_specificity: Cuminum cyminum (varieties: Isfahan and Kashan) under greenhouse conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects and mechanisms of naringenin on colorectal cancer (CRC), including its potential to inhibit proliferation and induce apoptosis, as well as its combined effects with 5-fluorouracil.
results_summary: Naringenin inhibited CRC proliferation and promoted apoptosis, activated AMPK phosphorylation and mitochondrial fusion, and, when combined with 5-fluorouracil, reduced cardiotoxicity and liver damage while enhancing anticancer effects. The combination altered mitochondrial function by increasing ROS levels and decreasing MMP, stimulating AMPK/mTOR signaling to regulate mitochondrial dynamics and induce apoptosis.
population_specificity: Colorectal cancer cells (in vitro) and nude mice bearing subcutaneous CRC tumors (in vivo).
interactions: Combined treatment with 5-fluorouracil was studied, showing reduced toxicity and enhanced efficacy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Naringenin (NAR) could protect against aluminum chloride (AlCl3)-induced neurotoxicity, memory impairment, and oxidative stress in mice.
results_summary: NAR significantly improved spatial learning and memory, restored oxidative stress parameters, and maintained the antioxidant defense system in AlCl3-exposed mice. It also restored neuronal proliferation marker NeuN expression, suggesting neuroprotective effects.
population_specificity: Mice with AlCl3-induced neurotoxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Naringenin-loaded hybridized nanoparticles (NAR-HNPs) and free Naringenin (NAR) on depression induced by streptozotocin (STZ) in diabetic rats, focusing on neurotransmitter modulation, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory effects.
results_summary: NAR and NAR-HNPs reduced depression-like behavior, lowered blood glucose, increased insulin levels, and improved neurotransmitter balance while reducing oxidative stress and inflammation via the PPAR-γ/NLRP3 pathway. NAR-HNPs showed superior pharmacokinetic and therapeutic outcomes compared to free NAR.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin-induced diabetic rats.
effective_dosage: 50 mg/kg (oral) for NAR and NAR-HNPs; 1 mg/kg (i.p.) for GW9662.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Naringenin could alleviate chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) and enhance the anti-tumor effects of paclitaxel.
results_summary: Naringenin reduced paclitaxel-induced pain, decreased CGRP expression, mitigated macrophage infiltration, and reversed neuronal excitability. It also enhanced paclitaxel's anti-tumor effects, possibly through apoptosis.
population_specificity: Female and male mouse models of chemotherapy-induced pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin could protect KGN cells from cadmium-induced damage by regulating oxidative stress, mitochondrial function, and inflammation.
results_summary: Naringenin improved cell viability, reduced caspase-3/-9 activities, diminished ROS production, restored antioxidant capacity, and mitigated mitochondrial dysfunction in cadmium-exposed KGN cells. Its protective effects were partially mediated by SIRT1.
population_specificity: KGN cell line (human granulosa-like tumor cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the active components of Citri Reticulatae Pericarpium (CRP) for treating acute liver injury (ALI) and validate naringenin's (NIN) mechanisms and effects.
results_summary: Naringenin reduced liver lesions, oxidative stress, and inflammation in APAP-induced ALI mice and inhibited proliferation while promoting apoptosis in LO2 cells, primarily via the PPARA-dependent pathway.
population_specificity: Mice with APAP-induced ALI and human LO2 liver cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antidepressant effects and neuroprotective mechanisms of naringenin, alone or in combination with liraglutide, in a mouse model of depression.
results_summary: Naringenin alleviated depressive behavior in mice by reducing anxiety, anhedonia, and despair. It improved neurogenesis, decreased neuroinflammation, and restored monoamine levels comparably to the reference drug escitalopram.
population_specificity: Mice with dexamethasone-induced depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Naringenin (NAR) has protective effects against radiation-induced intestinal injury (RIII) and to explore its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: NAR treatment improved survival rates, protected intestinal crypts and villi, reduced inflammation and immune cell infiltration, and mitigated intestinal barrier damage in irradiated mice. It also showed radioprotective effects in human colon cancer cells (HCT116) and intestinal epithelial cells (NCM460) by reducing calcium ion and ROS levels, and downregulating TRPV6.
population_specificity: C57BL/6J mice, human colon cancer cells (HCT116), and human intestinal epithelial cells (NCM460).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how naringenin affects monocyte/macrophage endothelial infiltration and vascular inflammation, particularly its role in inhibiting atherosclerosis progression.
results_summary: Naringenin reduced pro-inflammatory cytokines, inhibited TLR4 and NF-κB activity, decreased monocyte/macrophage infiltration, and attenuated lipid raft redox signaling, ultimately reducing vascular inflammation.
population_specificity: High-fat-diet-treated ApoE-deficient mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy of naringenin nanoparticles targeting cyclin B1 in suppressing the progression of rheumatoid arthritis-associated lung cancer by inhibiting fibroblast-to-myofibroblast transition.
results_summary: Naringenin nanoparticles targeting cyclin B1 effectively attenuated proliferation and fibroblast-to-myofibroblast transition by blocking cells at the G2/M phase, significantly alleviating collagen-induced arthritis and lung orthotopic tumors in vivo.
population_specificity: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis-associated lung cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the hypolipidemic and anti-obesity effects of Naringenin nanoparticles (Nar-NPs) in obese mice.
results_summary: Nar-NPs significantly reduced body weight, glucose, insulin, and lipid biomarkers while improving oxidative stress and inflammatory markers. The nanoparticles showed enhanced release and efficacy compared to pure naringenin.
population_specificity: Obese mice
study_duration: 24 hours (release study), intervention duration not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the liver-targeting efficacy and therapeutic potential of a novel nano-formulated Naringenin (NCG) for HR+ breast cancer treatment via oral administration.
results_summary: NCG demonstrated superior liver targeting, increased intestinal barrier permeability, and enhanced cancer inhibition compared to NAR and tamoxifen, with elevated hepatic EST expression and reduced estradiol levels in liver, blood, and tumor tissue, while showing few side effects.
population_specificity: Mouse breast cancer xenografts and zebrafish xenotransplantation models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Naringenin (NGN), both alone and complexed with hydroxypropyl-β-cyclodextrin (HPβCD), on neonatal endotoxemia injuries in a rodent model and explore its molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: NGN reduced leukocyte migration, decreased pro-inflammatory cytokine levels, upregulated IL-10 production, enhanced antioxidant enzyme activity, and attenuated oxidative damage in multiple organs. NGN complexed with HPβCD also increased animal survival rates.
population_specificity: Neonatal mice with LPS-induced endotoxemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-carcinogenic potential of naringenin by assessing its effects on ROS production, mitochondrial function, and apoptosis in melanoma cells.
results_summary: Naringenin reduced melanoma cell viability, increased ROS levels, induced mitochondrial damage, and promoted apoptosis by modulating proapoptotic and anti-apoptotic proteins. It also activated autophagy and JNK phosphorylation, suggesting its potential as a therapeutic agent for melanoma.
population_specificity: Melanoma cells (in vitro)
study_duration: Time-dependent effects observed, but exact duration not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Naringenin improves the viability of random skin flaps by reducing cell death mechanisms (pyroptosis, apoptosis, necroptosis), oxidative stress, and promoting autophagy.
results_summary: Naringenin increased flap viability and angiogenesis while reducing oxidative stress and cell death pathways (pyroptosis, apoptosis, necroptosis). These benefits were reversed by the autophagy inhibitor 3-methyladenine, suggesting autophagy activation as a key mechanism.
population_specificity: Mice with random skin flaps

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of naringenin and naringin as treatments for long COVID symptoms by examining their molecular mechanisms and clinical effects.
results_summary: The study found that naringenin and naringin have palliative effects on various long COVID symptoms, including inflammation, viral infections, and oxidative stress, suggesting their potential as nutraceuticals or clinical supplements.
population_specificity: Patients suffering from post-acute sequelae of SARS-CoV-2 infection (long COVID).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of naringenin (NAR) in reducing hair loss and promoting hair growth in mice.
results_summary: Naringenin significantly increased hair growth, hair follicle diameter, and quantity, along with boosting antioxidant capacity and vascular endothelial growth factor levels, though no effect was observed on keratinocyte growth factor. The combination of naringenin and minoxidil showed enhanced effects compared to controls.
population_specificity: Adult male Wistar Albino mice (6-7 weeks old, weighing 25-35 g).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin could protect against sepsis-induced myocardial dysfunction by targeting HIF-1α signaling.
results_summary: Naringenin improved cardiomyocyte damage in both in vivo and in vitro experiments, with HIF-1α identified as a key target. However, naringenin did not provide additional protection when combined with an HIF-1α inhibitor.
population_specificity: Cardiomyocytes and animal models of septic cardiomyopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of naringenin-loaded nanoformulations as a therapeutic alternative for treating glioblastoma and other neurological diseases.
results_summary: The study found that naringenin, when conjugated with nanocarriers, can cross the blood-brain barrier and has been tested in various in vitro and in vivo models as a potential treatment for brain disorders. Several nanocarriers, such as polymeric nanoparticles and liposomes, were employed to enhance drug delivery.
population_specificity: Primarily focused on glioblastoma (GBM) and neurological diseases, with implications for adults given GBM's prevalence in this group.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of naringenin on the pharmacokinetics of dasatinib and propose a possible interaction mechanism in Wistar rats.
results_summary: Naringenin pretreatment significantly enhanced dasatinib's plasma concentration and altered its pharmacokinetic parameters, increasing bioavailability and systemic exposure by inhibiting Cyp3a2, Mdr1/P-gp, and Bcrp1 expression, while suppressing hepatic and intestinal metabolism. This suggests a potential for serious drug interactions when naringenin is used concurrently with dasatinib.
population_specificity: Wistar rats
interactions: Significant interaction with dasatinib, potentially leading to adverse effects and toxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanism by which naringenin induces cell death in lung cancer cells and evaluate its anti-cancer effects in vitro and in vivo.
results_summary: Naringenin reduced cell viability, induced cell cycle arrest, and triggered autophagy in lung cancer cells (H1299 and A459) via ROS generation and AMPK signaling activation. It also suppressed tumor growth and promoted apoptosis in a xenograft mouse model.
population_specificity: Lung cancer cells (H1299 and A459) and a subcutaneous H1299 xenograft mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of gelatin-coated PCL nanofibers co-loaded with luliconazole and naringenin in accelerating the healing of infected diabetic wounds.
results_summary: The study found that the nanofiber matrix exhibited excellent biofilm inhibition against Candida strains and significantly accelerated wound healing in diabetic rats, with higher blood flow and rapid re-epithelialization compared to controls.
population_specificity: Diabetic rats with C. albicans-infected wounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin could protect against mercury chloride-induced oxidative stress and apoptosis in the liver and kidneys of rats.
results_summary: Naringenin significantly reduced oxidative stress markers (MDA, SOD, GSH-Px, GST) and apoptosis (caspase-3 levels), improved liver and kidney function (AST, ALT, LDH, urea, creatinine), and mitigated histopathological damage, with 100 mg/kg being more effective than 50 mg/kg.
population_specificity: 2-month-old male Wistar-Albino rats
effective_dosage: 50 mg/kg/day and 100 mg/kg/day, administered by gavage

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the mechanism of naringenin's anti-tumor effects on cervical cancer using network pharmacology and experimental validation.
results_summary: Naringenin demonstrated anti-cancer properties by attenuating Hela cell migration and invasion via downregulation of the EGFR/PI3K/AKT signaling pathway. The findings suggest therapeutic potential for cervical cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Hela cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Naringenin (NAR) could inhibit estrogen deficiency-associated obesity by promoting white adipose tissue (WAT) browning and improving metabolic dysfunction.
results_summary: NAR significantly reduced body weight and WAT mass, improved glucose intolerance and lipid profiles, and enhanced markers of WAT browning and mitochondrial biogenesis in both rats and 3T3-L1 adipocytes, primarily via AMP-activated protein kinase pathway modulation.
population_specificity: Ovariectomized (OVX) rats (in vivo) and 3T3-L1 adipocytes (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effects of Naringenin (NAR) against aluminum chloride (AlCl3)-induced liver and kidney toxicity in mice.
results_summary: NAR treatment maintained liver and kidney function enzymes, attenuated oxidative stress, regulated inflammatory cytokines, and reduced apoptotic damage in AlCl3-treated mice, demonstrating significant antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
population_specificity: Mice exposed to AlCl3-induced hepato-nephrotoxicity.
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg body weight/day for both AlCl3 and NAR.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin could regulate extracellular vesicle (EV)-mediated ferroptosis in lung epithelial cells exposed to cigarette smoke-induced alveolar macrophages.
results_summary: The study found that naringenin elevated EV miR-23a-3p levels from cigarette smoke extract-induced alveolar macrophages, inhibiting lung epithelial ferroptosis by targeting ACSL4. EVs from naringenin-treated macrophages attenuated ferroptosis compared to untreated controls.
population_specificity: Mice and in vitro lung epithelial cells exposed to cigarette smoke extract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of naringenin on apoptosis in human tongue carcinoma CAL-27 cells and its potential as a therapeutic candidate for tongue cancer.
results_summary: Naringenin significantly induced apoptosis in CAL-27 cells in a dose-dependent manner by upregulating Bid, downregulating Bcl-xl, and increasing ROS generation. The findings suggest naringenin may be a promising treatment for oral cancer by modulating apoptotic pathways.
population_specificity: Human tongue carcinoma CAL-27 cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the inhibitory effects of Naringenin (Nar) and ketoprofen-RGD on leukemia and ovarian cancer cells, focusing on proliferation and anti-inflammatory activity.
results_summary: Nar enhanced the effects of ketoprofen-RGD by inhibiting PDE1 and CaM, improving PKA activity and cAMP levels, reducing cancer cell viability, and demonstrating anti-inflammatory effects.
population_specificity: Leukemia (K562) and ovarian cancer (SKOV3) cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the mechanism by which naringenin alleviates non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) using multi-omics data.
results_summary: Naringenin prevented NASH-induced liver damage, reversed abnormal lipid and enzyme levels, and modulated gut microbiota and host metabolomic profiles, suggesting a therapeutic effect against NASH.
population_specificity: Male mice fed a NASH-inducing diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a more affordable and viable bioprocess for industrial naringenin production using engineered yeast strains.
results_summary: Naringenin was successfully produced in yeast through in silico design and multi-expression of four genes from various organisms. The batch kinetic behavior of the product, substrate, and biomass was characterized at lab scale, suggesting potential for scalable industrial production.
population_specificity: Lab-scale yeast cultures (not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a novel nanoparticle delivery system (TRNNs) could enhance naringenin's brain penetration and therapeutic effects in Alzheimer's Disease models.
results_summary: The study found that TRNNs significantly improved naringenin's brain penetration (8x higher accumulation) and demonstrated neuroprotective effects, including enhanced dendritic spine density, higher PSD95 expression, and improved cognitive performance in mice.
population_specificity: Mice (in vivo) and cell cultures (U-118MG, HCMEC/D3, PC12 cells)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the antioxidative stress mechanisms of Naringenin (NAR) and its nanoformulations, as well as their potential therapeutic effects on oxidative stress-related disorders.
results_summary: The study found that NAR and its nanoformulations exhibit significant antioxidative, anti-inflammatory, and protective effects against various diseases by modulating multiple signaling pathways. Nanoformulations improved NAR's pharmacokinetic properties, addressing limitations like low bioavailability.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of in vitro and in vivo studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether naringenin could modulate the suppressed innate immune response caused by PRRSV infection, specifically focusing on the RIG-I-MAVS signaling pathway.
results_summary: Naringenin improved the expression of antiviral cytokines suppressed by PRRSV infection and up-regulated proteins related to the RIG-I-MAVS immune signaling pathway, but its effect was blocked by a RIG-I inhibitor.
population_specificity: PRRSV-infected Marc-145 cells (a porcine kidney cell line).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate an inhalable dual-delivery system of naringenin and doxofylline for the treatment of asthma.
results_summary: The optimized system showed high drug entrapment and loading efficiencies, sustained drug release, and significant improvements in respiratory parameters and inflammatory markers in a murine asthma model.
population_specificity: Murine model of asthma

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism behind chitosan nanoparticle-encapsulated Naringenin (CS-NPs/NAR)-induced breast cancer cell death, focusing on oxidative stress and apoptosis.
results_summary: CS-NPs/NAR demonstrated cytotoxicity (37% and 29% reduction in cell viability at 24 and 48 hours) and reduced proliferation in MDA-MB-231 cells. It increased oxidative stress markers (NO, XOD, ROS) and activated procaspase3, suggesting apoptosis induction.
population_specificity: Breast cancer cells (MDA-MB-231) in vitro.
effective_dosage: 100, 200, and 200 µg of CS-NPs, NAR, and CS-NPs/NAR.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of naringenin (Nar) on the functional properties of Lepidium sativum leaves and roots, focusing on bioactive compound modulation and biological activities.
results_summary: The study found tissue-specific modulation of bioactive compounds by naringenin, but no synergistic effect when combined with rosmarinic acid (RA). RA alone increased anthocyanins and hydroxyphenyl propanoic acid content in leaves, enhancing biological activities, while naringenin's specific effects were less pronounced.
population_specificity: Lepidium sativum (garden cress) leaves and roots.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin could mitigate osteoarthritis symptoms by inhibiting the TLR4/TRAF6/NF-κB pathway and reducing inflammation and cartilage degradation.
results_summary: Naringenin reversed IL-1β-induced chondrocyte injury, reduced inflammatory factors, and inhibited extracellular matrix degradation in vitro. In a mouse osteoarthritis model, it alleviated pathological symptoms, suppressed TLR4/TRAF6/NF-κB signaling, and reduced cartilage damage.
population_specificity: Primary chondrocytes (in vitro) and a mouse osteoarthritis model (in vivo).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dose-dependent effects noted in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic efficacy and pharmacological mechanism of Naringenin in treating collagen-induced arthritis (CIA) in mice and its anti-inflammatory effects in vitro.
results_summary: Naringenin significantly reduced foot inflammation and pro-inflammatory cytokines in CIA mice, enhanced antioxidant capacity, and attenuated inflammation and ROS levels in LPS-induced RAW264.7 cells. It activated autophagy via the AMPK/ULK1 pathway, which was critical for its anti-inflammatory effects.
population_specificity: DBA/1 mice with collagen-induced arthritis (CIA) and LPS-induced RAW264.7 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether naringenin activates ERβ and improves β-cell function and glucose metabolism in diabetic rats.
results_summary: Naringenin specifically activated ERβ, enhanced glucose-stimulated insulin secretion in rat islets, and improved β-cell mass and glucose metabolism in diabetic rats, with these effects blocked by an ERβ antagonist.
population_specificity: Isolated rat islets and streptozocin-nicotinamide induced diabetic rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the functional mechanism of Naringenin in alleviating atopic dermatitis (AD) in mice through the JAK2/STAT3 pathway.
results_summary: Naringenin reduced dermatitis severity, ear thickness, inflammatory markers (TNF-α, IL-6, IFN-γ, IL-12, IL-5), and serum IgE levels while inhibiting the JAK2/STAT3 pathway, though its effects were partially nullified by pathway activation.
population_specificity: DNFB-induced AD mouse models

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether naringenin supplementation could mitigate oxidative stress and behavioral impairments in a rotenone-induced Parkinson's disease model in rats.
results_summary: Naringenin reduced motor and non-motor impairments, lowered oxidative stress, and restored neurotransmitter levels in rotenone-treated rats. The findings suggest naringenin may have therapeutic potential for Parkinson's disease.
population_specificity: Rats with rotenone-induced Parkinson's disease-like symptoms.
study_duration: Two weeks for pre-treatment, two weeks for post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to isolate and elucidate the structure of metabolites (compounds 1 and 2) produced by Priestia megaterium in the presence of gold nanoparticles (AuNPs).
results_summary: The metabolites were identified as daidzein and genistein, and transcriptomic analysis showed enhanced gene expression (csoR and yijB) in response to AuNPs, while CHS remained unaffected.
population_specificity: Priestia megaterium (bacterial culture)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the neuroprotective effects of Naringenin, focusing on its mechanisms, potential therapeutic benefits for neurological diseases, and its chemistry and pharmacokinetics.
results_summary: The study found that Naringenin exhibits neuroprotective effects by reducing neurotoxicity, oxidative stress, and neuroinflammation, and shows promise as an anti-amyloidogenic, antidepressant, and neurotrophic agent.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanisms and potential targets of naringenin (NR) for treating nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) using network pharmacology.
results_summary: The study identified 89 crossover targets and 16 core targets of NR for NAFLD treatment, involving multiple biological processes and signaling pathways, suggesting a multi-target and multi-pathway therapeutic effect. Enrichment analysis highlighted NR's role in regulating pathways like Hepatitis B, lipid metabolism, and AGE-RAGE signaling in diabetic complications.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico study, no human or animal subjects mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of naringenin and its nanoparticle form on inhibiting HepG2 liver cancer cell proliferation.
results_summary: Naringenin inhibited HepG2 cell proliferation, with nanoparticle-formulated naringenin showing significantly lower IC50 values (indicating higher potency) compared to free naringenin at both 24 and 48 hours.
population_specificity: In vitro study using human liver cancer (HepG2) cell line.
effective_dosage: IC50 values provided (free naringenin: 14.57 ± 1.78 µg/mL at 24h, 11.37 ± 1.45 µg/mL at 48h; nanoparticle naringenin: 7.25 ± 0.17 µg/mL at 24h, 5.21 ± 0.18 µg/mL at 48h).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Naringenin (NGN) could protect against Dasatinib (DASA)-induced acute liver injury in a mouse model.
results_summary: Pretreatment with NGN minimized proinflammatory mediators (IL-10, TNF-α, MDA) and restored antioxidant gene levels (SOD, CAT, GST, GPx), reducing DASA-induced liver damage. Histopathological findings showed NGN attenuated necro-inflammatory changes caused by DASA.
population_specificity: Mice (animal model)
study_duration: 7 days (NGN pretreatment) + single DASA dose on the 8th day

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of long-term supplementation with Citrus peel extract (containing naringenin) on cognitive performance and inflammation in individuals with subjective cognitive decline (SCD).
results_summary: The study found no significant cognitive benefits of Citrus peel extract over placebo, with both groups showing similar improvements in cognitive scores and increased IL-8 levels. Adverse events were balanced between groups, indicating no additional risks from the extract.
population_specificity: Older adults with subjective cognitive decline (SCD).
effective_dosage: 400 mg of Citrus peel extract containing 3.0 mg of naringenin and 0.1 mg of auraptene, administered daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of naringenin as an antioxidant and free radical scavenger to mitigate mitochondrial toxicity associated with NRTIs in HIV treatment.
results_summary: The abstract suggests naringenin has antioxidant properties that could prevent mitochondrial toxicity from NRTIs, but clinical intervention with antioxidants has previously been unsuccessful due to low efficacy or poor experimental designs.
population_specificity: HIV-positive patients on combination antiretroviral therapy (cARVs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of naringenin supplementation on cardiovascular risk factors in overweight/obese patients with NAFLD.
results_summary: Naringenin significantly reduced atherogenic indices, serum non-HDL-C levels, BMI, and visceral fat, with marginal reductions in systolic blood pressure and improvements in hematological indices. No significant differences were found for other outcomes.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese patients with NAFLD (n=44).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and clinical utility of nasal irrigation as a treatment for rhinitis and rhinosinusitis.
results_summary: The study found that nasal irrigation significantly reduced symptom intensity and improved daily life impact in patients with rhinitis or rhinosinusitis. A specific product containing PEG, bicarbonates, and sodium chloride administered via a squeezable bottle demonstrated these benefits.
population_specificity: Patients with rhinitis or rhinosinusitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of acute and chronic intake of Bifidobacterium longum R0175 on the bioavailability of orange juice flavanones, including naringenin, in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: Chronic probiotic intake over 4 weeks increased the bioavailability of naringenin-O-glucuronides, with urinary excretion rising to 27% of intake, while acute intake showed no significant effect. Overall bioavailability of flavanones and phenolic acids reached 70% after chronic probiotic supplementation.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers
study_duration: Acute study (single dose) and chronic study (4 weeks)

study_goal: To assess the feasibility and acceptability of saline nasal irrigation for acute sinusitis and compare it to usual care with delayed antibiotic prescriptions.
results_summary: The study found that saline nasal irrigation was deemed acceptable by participants, with high adherence rates (96% in the first week, 65% in the second week). Antibiotic use was lower in the saline group (60%) compared to usual care (38%).
population_specificity: Adults with acute sinusitis recruited from 24 English general practices.
effective_dosage: High volume hypertonic saline nasal irrigation (specific volume not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the drug delivery efficiency of nasal irrigation versus nebulisation in post-operative sinonasal models and evaluate how anatomical changes affect deposition across sinuses.
results_summary: Nasal irrigation showed higher efficiency in delivering drugs to the frontal sinuses compared to nebulisation, though residual liquid layers on sinus walls complicate direct comparisons. Surgical modifications improved nebuliser deposition in other sinuses.
population_specificity: Post-FESS models derived from a 29-year-old female CRS patient.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety of long-term corticosteroid nasal irrigation (6 months) on the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis in patients with chronic rhinosinusitis (CRS) post endoscopic sinus surgery.
results_summary: Serum morning cortisol levels showed no significant changes after 6 months of budesonide nasal irrigation, though three patients had mildly abnormal levels at 3 months that normalized by 6 months. The study concluded that long-term use did not significantly affect HPA axis function.
population_specificity: 17 patients with chronic rhinosinusitis (CRS) post endoscopic sinus surgery.
effective_dosage: 1 mg/day (250 ml via squeeze bottle, twice daily).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cytotoxicity of corticosteroid nasal irrigation solutions versus commercially available corticosteroid nasal sprays on human nasal epithelial cells.
results_summary: Nasal irrigation with mometasone or budesonide at standard therapeutic concentrations showed less cytotoxicity compared to nasal sprays (mometasone and fluticasone) at stock concentrations. Diluted nasal sprays exhibited similar cytotoxicity to therapeutic irrigation, suggesting benzalkonium chloride as a primary cytotoxic agent.
population_specificity: Primary human nasal epithelial cells from patients with nasal polyps and healthy nasal mucosa (n=6 each).
effective_dosage: Standard therapeutic concentrations for irrigation; stock and diluted (1:10) concentrations for sprays.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of normal saline nasal irrigation as an adjunct treatment for managing allergic rhinitis symptoms in children aged 6 to 12 years.
results_summary: The study found that nasal irrigation significantly reduced sneezing frequency, nasal cleansing requirements, and ocular symptoms compared to standard care alone, with improved quality of life scores at follow-ups.
population_specificity: Children aged 6 to 12 years with allergic rhinitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether nasal irrigation with saline solution reduces symptom severity in pediatric upper respiratory tract infections (URTIs).
results_summary: The review found that nasal irrigation with saline may reduce symptom severity and even accelerate recovery in children with URTIs, though the evidence is limited to four studies with a level of evidence of 2 and a recommendation strength of B.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (children, infants, adolescents) with upper respiratory tract infections.
